revised_title: Dispersion of Non-Newtonian Fluids in Laminar Flow through Circular Tubes
tldr: This article extends Taylor's analysis of the dispersion of soluble matter in laminar flow in a circular tube to Bingham plastic and Ellis model fluids. The authors find that the effective dispersion coefficient depends on the fluid's properties and can be calculated using Aris's approach. The results show that the previous findings for Newtonian fluids and power-law fluids can be derived from this work, and Aris's modification can be applied to non-Newtonian fluids.
